body: This updates `tokio` which was (I think) the only one that didn't get updated in #1183. Seems to work fine from my testing.

body:
Last preparations before the next release. :)

Fixes #1189.

If you think that everything's fine, I can also bump the version number.

title: switch to project domain for controls interface

milestone.title: v0.3.5
milestone.description: tracking milestone for another minor release of Spotifyd

body:
Since we now have our own domain, we should use that before committing to the one from GitHub before the release.

(The shorter name completely changed the formatting somehow.)

body: New method to allow to set shuffle value, copy of #1173

title: add CNAME to gh-pages
body: This prevents the action to overwrite our custom domain name. See [here](https://github.com/marketplace/actions/github-pages-action#%EF%B8%8F-add-cname-file-cname) for documentation.

title: remove snap files and mentions
body: Since the [official snap has been taken down](https://github.com/Spotifyd/spotifyd/issues/1028#issuecomment-1248526421) some time ago, this removes the remaining leftovers in the repository.

milestone.title: v0.3.5
milestone.description: tracking milestone for another minor release of Spotifyd

body: There were no major changes to the code. Tested to function as expected.

title: Librespot upgrade to 0.4

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

milestone.title: v0.3.5
milestone.description: tracking milestone for another minor release of Spotifyd

body:
Upgrades librespot to 0.4

# Considerations

- Audio normalization: I'm unsure of the changes, but I think we could improve clipping with normilazation when using softvol
- Credentials: librespot now seems to want to handle credentials storage by itself. Should we hand over this job?

title: update keyring crate
body:
This updates to the newest release of the keyring crate and updates the messages of the keyring query. From my testing, this is backwards compatible with the previous version – at least the parts that we were using.

Fixes #1086. (at least the last update there was, that changes in keyring, which have landed, might resolve the issue)

title: update badges and add link to matrix

milestone.title: v0.3.5
milestone.description: tracking milestone for another minor release of Spotifyd

body:
This removes/updates some obsolete badges and adds a new one for the matrix room. ([Preview](https://github.com/Spotifyd/spotifyd/tree/badge-updates#readme))

Justification for the individual updates / removals:
- contributors are also listed on the right side of the repo's front page and haven't been updated in a while
- cargo downloads don't accurately represent the actual downloads of this project, which probably happen more via GitHub releases or other distributions (the shown number is less than the amount of stars this repo has)
- the CI and CD badge didn't match the style of the others, so I went for the ones from shields.io

Now, when we're already at it, would you prefer a [different style](https://shields.io/#styles) for the badges?

title: Add project website link to readme
body:
I'd have preferred to add the mdbook link and then put the project website link in the sidebar, but in the meantime I think this'll do.

Also, as an aside, right now https://spotifyd.rs just links to the github, docs, matrix, etc. If anyone has suggestions for changes or things to add, just let me know (the code is hosted at https://github.com/slondr/spotifyd.rs).

title: New DBUS method: TransferPlayback

milestone.title: v0.3.5
milestone.description: tracking milestone for another minor release of Spotifyd

body:
This is a new TransferPlayback method available for DBUS. It's useful in my setup where spotifyd is part of audio system based on dietpi micro computer. It's used to transfer playback from other active spotify device.

Also i discovered weird error when setting my spotifyd device type to S_T_B. It was returned from device() method of spotify client as STB (all capitals) and was throwing error:
 ```
 json parse error: unknown variant `STB`, expected one of `Computer`, `Tablet`, `Smartphone`, `Speaker`, `Tv`, `Avr`, `Stb`, `AudioDongle`, `GameConsole`, `CastVideo`, `CastAudio`, `Automobile`, `Unknown` at line 16 column 18
```
 I didn't find `STB` anywhere in code so i assume that spotify changes that somehow ?

title: remove workaround for rspotify id types

milestone.title: v0.3.5
milestone.description: tracking milestone for another minor release of Spotifyd

body:
This upgrades `rspotify` to `0.11.6` and removes the workaround that was introduced in #1079, for which there is now much better library support.

related: #1144

title: feat: option for audio format

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: A new feature that would improve Spotifyd

milestone.title: v0.3.5
milestone.description: tracking milestone for another minor release of Spotifyd

body:
Add support for audio-format configuration.

Closes https://github.com/Spotifyd/spotifyd/issues/1081

title: Added alternative to disable changing volume
body:
I added an alternative to "softvol" and "alsa"; "none".
If remotely changing volume, or resetting it on restart is undesired, this is a fix.
